title: Frank Lampard reveals texts with Jose Mourinho after he 'had a go' at Chelsea following Man Utd loss
text:
Chelsea boss Frank Lampard and former Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho (Pictures: Getty)

Frank Lampard has revealed he remains in contact with Jose Mourinho and says he spoke to the legendary manager after he ‘had a little go’ at Chelsea earlier in the season.

Lampard’s management career in the Premier League got off to the worst possible start as Manchester United thumped his Chelsea team 4-0 on the opening weekend of the season.

Thankfully for the Chelsea legend, performances and results have improved since then and the Blues are joint-fourth in the Premier League ahead of Saturday’s clash with Newcastle.

The Red Devils smashed Chelsea on the opening day of the season (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United, meanwhile, have won just once in the league since their emphatic win over Chelsea and could drop into the relegation zone on Sunday.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, who replaced Mourinho last season, is under extreme pressure to save his job.

Chelsea manager Lampard told talkSPORT: ‘With Jose we would have texts from time to time. We had some at the start of the season around the United game where he had a little go!

‘It’s all good. I’ve sat in the punditry chair for a year so I understand the need to say things so I’m certainly not going to bang on too much. In terms of him, yeah we have a relationship.’

Lampard also says he speaks to his uncle, Harry Redknapp, about management. Redknapp has worked at the likes of West Ham, Portsmouth and Tottenham.

‘Harry Redknapp is Uncle Harry so it would sound wrong if I didn’t speak to him, but he was great for me in getting me the role at Derby,’ Lampard added.

‘He was close to Mel Morris [the chairman]. He followed us brilliantly last year.

‘He would text me and call me to talk about Derby and is doing the same at Chelsea so I have to shout Harry even though he is family.

‘What he did for me in terms of getting me on the ladder managerially is huge and I will always be thankful for that.

‘I had really good relationships with my managers. Guus Hiddink has actually sent me some great messages.

‘But you move on a bit and it doesn’t become like you were more acquaintances but I have huge respect for all of them.’

On Saturday, Chelsea face a Newcastle side who stunned Manchester United prior to the international break but remain 16th in the Premier League.
